intro: Centaurea paniculata, commonly known as the panicled centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange-red flowers arranged in panicles, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and dry grasslands. Centaurea paniculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
